children.subject: You might not be able to get into the class in spring if you are junior or senior. That is why you should take it this fall.

history.content: If you're not declared CS/EECS, it's very unlikely you'll get in that class your junior and senior years.

children.subject: can you post a pic of this email?
I'm going off of what OP said in their post, I don't have the email myself

Since the email says you should take it during the 2021-2022 academic year, you should be fine taking it in Spring 2022. That being said, don't delay it any further or you could run into some serious problems

history.content:
If you are an EECS and/or CS declared major. You were highly encouraged to waitlist EECS 16B in Phase I, especially if you are a junior or senior. If you did not waitlist the class in Phase I, I highly suggest contacting the professors to ask what they recommend at this point. It will be very difficult to get into EECS 16B as a junior or senior in Spring 2022.

The following message was sent to students in May: 

  • For Fall 2021, we will prioritize students that waitlist during Phase I for EECS 16B. Priority enrollment from the waitlist will be done in the following order. 
    • LSCS and EECS Seniors
    • LSCS and EECS Juniors
    • LSCS and EECS Sophomores. 
    • EECS and L&S Freshman
    • Students who fall outside of the above categories may add themselves to the waitlist and will be added during the Adjustment Period, if space allows. 
    • The department reserves the right to move declared seniors and juniors that add during phase I to the top of the waitlist based on the day/time they joined the waitlist.

For students with Expected Graduation Terms (EGT) of Fall 2021, Spring 2022, Fall 2022, or Spring 2023 it is important to add to the waitlist to make sure you will be able to graduate on time. The Department will not be able to prioritize access to EECS 16B in Fall 2021 for students who do not waitlist during Phase 1. For future offerings of EECS 16B, the Instructors and Department plan to apply the long-standing enrollment policy which limits seats for upper-division students and prioritizes lower-division students.

<md>Recently, I've received an email from ESS recommend taking EE 16B during the 2021-2022 year. Since I am an EMS major too, I am wondering if I can put off EE 16B to spring 2022 (without CalCentral doing something extremely goofy) so I can fit in CS 170 and some math courses.

</md>
history.subject: EECS Policies
